When I run it in Eclipse IDE using "Run as SWT application", it crashed.
Then I download the SWT linux runtime 3.1.2 binary files and specify the -Djava.library.path=THE SWT DIRECTORY, it crashed too and the same exceptions.

I installed the libcairo2. It seemed that eclipse requires libcairo1. 
in my /usr/lib there is only cairo 2 so files.
So it means eclipse cannot work with cairo 2, is it right?

Eclipse 3.1 only runs against cairo 0.5.1 which was the only available version (unstable) of cairo when eclipse 3.1 shipped. So you need that version to run. See also bug#106527.

Eclipse 3.2 has been ported to cairo 1.x. You won't have this problem running the latest i-build.
